jobs.title: Junior Quantitative Trader
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What is Noise Trading?

We make markets where no one else can — in the flows of culture and social attention. Noise Trading powers the world’s first financial contracts on attention. We provide continuous liquidity, tighten spreads, and ensure markets on Noise remain deep, efficient, and tradable — no matter where the conversation moves.

Working at Noise Trading

Our Values

  • Markets First — We focus entirely on trading and market impact, free from sales quotas or politics.

  • Merit & Collaboration — The best ideas win. We work side by side across trading, research, and technology to solve complex problems.

  • Learning & Curiosity — We embrace challenges, refine strategies daily, and value sharp thinkers who thrive on solving hard problems.

  • Freedom & Accountability — We provide the capital, tools, and autonomy to trade at the highest level, with performance and discipline driving rewards.

  • Unlimited Potential — Compensation scales directly with results, with no ceiling for top performers.

Role

We are seeking a Junior Quantitative Trader to drive high-impact strategies at the intersection of markets, data, and technology. You will own the full lifecycle of trading—designing and executing strategies, leveraging proprietary systems, managing risk in real time, and innovating on new approaches that directly impact firm performance and profitability.

Responsibilities

  • Operate and refine our proprietary trading system to achieve consistent, scalable returns

  • Apply disciplined risk-management practices: tune parameters, monitor anomalies, and enforce controls

  • Monitor real-time market data, adapt strategies dynamically, and collaborate with technology teams

  • Create and submit trading reports and post-trade analyses

  • Identify limitations, conceptualize enhancements, and develop next-generation trading strategies

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in STEM (e.g., mathematics, engineering, computer science); fresh graduates invited to apply

  • Strong analytical thinking, comfortable with uncertainty, and a systematic approach

  • Familiarity with programming or scripting tools (Python, C++, or similar)

  • Excellent communication skills, fast learner, and strong self-management

Nice to Haves:

  • Background in competitive strategy domains such as gaming, poker, or chess

How Applying Works

  1. Technical Round 1 — 30 minute Mental Math Assessment

  2. Technical Round 2 — 45 minute Brain Teaser Assessment

  3. Behavioral Call — 45 minute chat with one of the founders

  4. Reference Checks — Share 2-3 references of previous supervisors you’ve worked with

  5. Comp Review — 30 minutes chat with one of the founders to go over the offer

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Backend & Systems
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What is Noise?

People want to be informed and entertained. Great products make the two inseparable.

Noise is a platform to discover and trade trends. Every day, millions of people make predictions about what will continue to matter: a brand, a conflict, a new technology. These predictions shape the global economy and advance culture. AI slop and the internet have accelerated content production to such an extent that predicting trends has become nearly impossible.

Noise exists to solve this. We measure attention across the internet and allow people to trade on its future. The result is real-time markets on how brands, narratives, and ideas rise and fall. If we succeed, Noise becomes the standard for measuring attention and a new way to reveal what truly matters in the world.

To learn more, follow us on X.

Working at Noise

A little bit about our team:

  • Eight full-time employees based in the US

  • Fully in-person in NYC

  • Everyone either ships code, designs, or talks to users

Our Values

  • Build in the Unknown: We have no interest in iterating on what already exists. Our goal is to create a new type of consumer experience centered on invention, not optimization.

  • Seek Truth Rapidly: We consider it a mistake to linger in speculation. We test, learn from feedback, and move forward with speed and clarity.

  • No Passengers: Everyone at Noise — engineers, designers, marketers — is in the room, in New York City. We’re a small team moving fast with care and intensity. We solve hard problems together. You do not need permission to try new things.

  • Action Your Taste: Our work carries the imprint of everyone who builds it.

Role

We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer – Backend & Systems at Noise. You’re a generalist at heart but specialize in backend: designing and building large-scale, distributed, real-time systems, APIs, and data pipelines. You’ll shape architecture decisions, move fast from prototype to production, and own your systems end to end — there’s no handoff here.

Responsibilities

  • Architect and build backend services and APIs able to handle large-scale traffic and real-time data.

  • Design distributed systems: microservices, message queues, caching, orchestration, Kubernetes & cloud infrastructure.

  • Ensure system scale, performance, reliability, security and observability (monitoring, logging, alerting).

  • Collaborate across product, front-end and infrastructure teams to deliver end-to-end solutions.

  • Define and drive best practices for code quality, deployment, infrastructure and system operations

Qualifications

  • 4+ years of backend (or full-stack) development building production services in modern server-side languages (Go, Rust, Java, Python, etc.).

  • Proven experience designing, shipping and operating backend systems at scale.

  • Deep understanding of distributed systems, performance optimization, reliability, and cloud infrastructure (AWS or equivalent).

  • Solid experience working with Kubernetes (K8s), container orchestration, service deployments and infrastructure as code.

  • Strong ownership mindset: from concept → production → maintenance, you can own features and systems end-to-end.

  • Bonus: Open‐source contributions or active community involvement

Our Tech Stack

  • Design: Figma, Adobe

  • Frontend (web): React (Typescript), Vite, TailwindCSS

  • Backend: Rust, Java, Typescript

  • Research: Python, Pytorch

  • Infrastructure: AWS, Cloudflare

  • Smart Contracts: Solidity, Foundry, Slither

How Applying Works

  1. Intro Call — 30 minutes to review your relevant experience

  2. Behavioral Call — 45 minutes to learn more about you

  3. Paid Work Trial — 3-5 days work trial with the team (in-office)

  4. Reference Checks — Provide 2-3 prior supervisors

  5. Comp Review — 30 minutes with one of the founders to discuss offer

Compensation

To attract the best people, our goal is to provide competitive cash compensation and high upside in the long-term success of Noise. Equity options are subject to the same four-year schedule as the rest of the team.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - iOS
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What is Noise?

People want to be informed and entertained. Great products make the two inseparable.

Noise is a platform to discover and trade trends. Every day, millions of people make predictions about what will continue to matter: a brand, a conflict, a new technology. These predictions shape the global economy and advance culture. AI slop and the internet have accelerated content production to such an extent that predicting trends has become nearly impossible.

Noise exists to solve this. We measure attention across the internet and allow people to trade on its future. The result is real-time markets on how brands, narratives, and ideas rise and fall. If we succeed, Noise becomes the standard for measuring attention and a new way to reveal what truly matters in the world.

To learn more, follow us on X.

Working at Noise

A little bit about our team:

  • Eight full-time employees based in NYC

  • Fully in-person in SoHo, NYC

  • Everyone either ships code, designs, or talks to users

Our Values

  • Build in the Unknown: We have no interest in iterating on what already exists. Our goal is to create a new type of consumer experience centered on invention, not optimization.

  • Seek Truth Rapidly: We consider it a mistake to linger in speculation. We test, learn from feedback, and move forward with speed and clarity.

  • No Passengers: Everyone at Noise — engineers, designers, marketers — is in the room, in New York City. We’re a small team moving fast with care and intensity. We solve hard problems together. You do not need permission to try new things.

  • Action Your Taste: Our work carries the imprint of everyone who builds it.

Role

We’re seeking a Senior Software Engineer with an iOS focus — someone who codes first and designs second. As the first in-house mobile engineer, you’ll own the iOS effort end-to-end: shaping the foundation, architecting the app, and driving it from zero to launch. You’ll work closely with the cofounders to ensure deep compatibility with existing web applications and to translate product vision into fast, reliable, and beautifully crafted mobile experiences. You care deeply about PREQ and product quality.

Responsibilities

  • Prototype and iterate rapidly with the product designer to validate ideas.

  • Architect and implement fast, reusable iOS components that scale across devices.

  • Optimize for performance and accessibility, ensuring every frame and gesture feels native.

  • Craft thoughtful motion and interaction systems — from transitions to micro-interactions.

  • Shape and expand our design system, setting the standard for mobile craftsmanship.

  • Collaborate across product, backend, and web teams to build cohesive end-to-end experiences.

Qualifications

  • Deep experience in iOS development (Swift, iOS SDK) and the full lifecycle from concept to App Store launch.

  • Strong command of performance, concurrency, memory management, and responsiveness.

  • A refined eye for UI/UX details — motion, spacing, typography, and tactile feedback.

  • Comfortable turning Figma or Adobe designs into production-ready code with precision.

  • Bonus: experience in WebGL, Three.js, or creative coding for expressive, high-impact visuals.

Our Tech Stack

  • Design: Figma, Adobe

  • Frontend (web): React (Typescript), Vite, TailwindCSS

  • Backend: Rust, Java, Typescript

  • Research: Python, Pytorch

  • Infrastructure: AWS, Cloudflare

  • Smart Contracts: Solidity, Foundry, Slither

(Note: This is our broader stack — this role is focused on mobile iOS development.)

How Applying Works

  1. Intro Call — 30 minutes to review your relevant experience

  2. Behavioral Call — 45 minutes to learn more about you

  3. Paid Work Trial — 3-5 days work trial with the team (in-office)

  4. Reference Checks — Provide 2-3 prior supervisors

  5. Comp Review — 30 minutes with one of the founders to discuss offer

Compensation

To attract the best people, our goal is to provide competitive cash compensation and high upside in the long-term success of Noise. Equity options are subject to the same four-year schedule as the rest of the team.
